citations.narrative:
On July 19, 2024, an Australian Shepherd dog escaped from a public visitor’s car and crawled under the gate into the cow
elk enclosure, chased and herded a group of 13 elk, causing “Wanda”, Tag #66, to break a leg. Wanda was humanely
euthanized following the incident. All enclosure gates in the Center were immediately retrofitted with a heavy-duty fencing
panel sweep to prevent access by nuisance animals into the enclosures. Additionally, the facility added more signage
about keeping dogs in cars to the facility buildings and enclosures, and on the entrance receipts.
Enclosures which cannot keep other animals out are unable to protect the animals from predation, injury, or death. The
facility and enclosures must be constructed such that they protect the animals from injury and contain the animals.
Corrected prior to the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On July 19, 2024, an Australian Shepherd dog escaped from a public visitor’s car and crawled under the gate into the cow 
elk enclosure, chased and herded a group of 13 elk, causing “Wanda”, Tag #66, to break a leg. Wanda was humanely 
euthanized following the incident. All enclosure gates in the Center were immediately retrofitted with a heavy-duty fencing 
panel sweep to prevent access by nuisance animals into the enclosures. Additionally, the facility added more signage 
about keeping dogs in cars to the facility buildings and enclosures, and on the entrance receipts. 
Enclosures which cannot keep other animals out are unable to protect the animals from predation, injury, or death. The 
facility and enclosures must be constructed such that they protect the animals from injury and contain the animals.  
Corrected prior to the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
